comment.author: 21686909@N07
comment._content: the whole notion of playing tennis in a long skirt is just plain nuts, but they were "ladies" and couldn't show their legs.  Why didn't they wear white slacks?

comment.author: 58764797@N00
comment._content: From the NY Times, 9/17/1911 "By a remarkable show of her old driving game, Mrs. Marshall McLean of the West Side Tennis Club captured three of the New Jersey State championships..." (singles, women's doubles with Mrs. George L. Chapman, and mixed doubles with Halstead Little) And who knows how long this link will last, but query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?_r=1&res=950CE... She also appears in www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4351606578
